description.div: A segment or set of human activities relevant for survival. The activity may be benefitial to the individual or to the community of the individual. The ultimate beneficiary are next generations of the community. Thus while activities might at first seem to benefit a sea or a mountain, the benefit is supposed to be transferred over various relays to its ultimate destination.

A building owned and administered by a tongxianghui, or Landsmannschaft, an association of migrants from China or Taiwan, who hold meetings and activities of the tongxianghui in this building, and run the administration and business of the tongxianghui. Frequently the huiguan may also function as the museum and the library for the tongxianghui. The huiguan might also include a temple dedicated to the god or godess related to their business or the origin of their migration.

Many huiguan reflect the business activities of the tongxianghui. The interior might look like a bank. Alternatively, in the yard of the huiguan, imported and to be exported products are loaded onto or from trucks.

The appearance of huiguan depends largely on the country they are located in and the functions the state assumes. While in well-run countries like Singapore, the tongxianghui can concentrate on representative and commemorative functions, in countries, where generals or state officials abandon the service to their citizens, the tongxianghui might run a hospital, a funeral home, a fire fighter station or a rescue team.

A 石敢當 is an object onto which "石敢當" has been carved as self-reference. The function of an Shigandang is usually apotropaic, protecting a village, a house, a curved road or an intersection from negative forces.

The broken column is a tombstone in form of a column that is broken at its top. It is generally said to represent the death of a young and aspiring man whoes life ended before he could reach his potentials.
We should try to keep a record of a) whether the column has been restricted to men only and b) what the age of death of the deceased were.

Plus Codes are like street addresses for people or places that don't have one. Instead of addresses with street names and numbers, Plus Codes are based on latitude and longitude, and displayed as numbers and letters. With a Plus Code, people can receive deliveries, access emergency and social services, or just help other people find them.
Plus Codes technology is open source and free to create and use. They are much shorter than traditional global coordinates, so they're easy to share.
Plus Codes are based on a set of 20 alphanumeric characters. They do not include easily confused characters, are not case-sensitive, and they exclude vowels.
The resolution of the area can be changed by adding or removing characters after the '+' sign.
A site is a place that is of interest or concern.
This class comprises pieces of land or sea floor.

In contrast to the purely geometric notion of E53 Place, this class describes constellations of matter on the surface of the Earth or other celestial body, which can be represented by photographs, paintings and maps.
Instances of E27 Site are composed of relatively immobile material items and features in a particular configuration at a particular location.
Examples:
the Amazon river basin (Hegen, 1966)
Knossos (Evans, 1921)
the Apollo 11 landing site (Siegler and Smrekar, 2014)
Heathrow Airport (Wicks, 2014)
the submerged harbour of the Minoan settlement of Gournia, Crete (Watrous, 2012)
the island of Crete
